BiblioData.Title: SUBSTRATE WITH A REFLECTIVE LAYER, USABLE TO FABRICATE A REFLECTIVE- TYPE MASK BLANK FOR EUV LITHOGRAPHY
BiblioData.Abstract: There are provided a substrate with a reflective layer and an EUV mask blank, which can prevent particles from adhering to a surface of the reflective layer or an absorbing layer, or into a reflective layer or an absorbing layer during formation thereof by eliminating electrical connection between a film formed on a front surface of the substrate and a film formed on a rear surface of the substrate. A substrate with a reflective layer, which is usable to fabricate a reflective mask blank for EUV lithography, comprising a chucking layer formed on a rear surface opposite a surface with the reflective layer formed thereon, the chucking layer serving to chuck and support the substrate by an electrostatic chuck, wherein the reflective layer has no electrical connection to the chucking layer.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:

A substrate with a reflective layer, which is usable to fabricate a reflective mask blank for EUV lithography, comprising a chucking layer formed on a rear surface opposite a front surface with the reflective layer formed thereon, the chucking layer serving to chuck and support the substrate by an electrostatic chuck, wherein the reflective layer has no electrical connection to the chucking layer.
2. The substrate with a reflective layer according to claim 1, wherein the resistance value between the reflective layer and the chucking layer is 1 M[Omega] or above.

3. The substrate with a reflective layer according to claim 1, wherein the substrate has a non-conducting portion formed on the rear surface, and a region where the non-conducting portion is formed has a width of 2 mm or above when the width of the region is represented by a minimum value.
4. The substrate with a reflective layer according to claim 1, wherein the chucking layer is formed in a circular shape.
5. The substrate with a reflective layer according to claim 4, wherein the circular shape has a smaller diameter than a cross-sectional shape of the electrostatic chuck.

6. The substrate with a reflective layer according to claim 1, wherein a region where the chucking layer is formed has a smaller area than a contact area of the electrostatic chuck, with the substrate, when the substrate is supported by the electrostatic chuck.
